intro: Sarcathria ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous sarcathria, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution, Sarcathria ambigua is of interest to botanists studying plant diversity and adaptation.
